Just a nit, but...

On 12/11/05, Jeff Nielsen <jeff.nielsen@...=
m> wrote:
>
> By calling an (overloaded) class method from within the const=
ructor


That method is overridden, not overloaded, which means something d=
ifferent.

As for the problem at hand, Java handles it better then C++ but =
I agree with
Jeff, you should avoid calling public or protected methods fro=
m your
constructor.
